Module com.example.nasaapiproject
Package com.example.nasaapiproject

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
com.example.nasaapiproject.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
JavaFX elements and ids with interactions
  • JavaFX dateInput @fx:id DatePicker - Allows user to select date from calendar. All photoIDs from selected day are added to photoList and displayed in ListView.
  • JavaFX ListView @fx:id photoList - Displays list of photoIDs from date selected.
  • JavaFX imageView @fx:id imageV - Displays images associated with selected photoID in Listview from specified date.
  • JavaFX TextArea @fx:id imageInfo - Displays all metadata associated with selected photo. Data displayed is pulled from JSONObject apiPhotos using keyset from photoID.
  • JavaFX TextField @fx:id imgSrcText - Displays link from String ApiKey. Returns link with image from selected date.
  • JavaFX Button @fx:id downloadbutton - Executes method downloadImage();
  • JavaFX Button @fx:id copyButton - Executes method copyText();
  • JavaFX Hypyerlink @fx:id historybutton - Sets int mode to -1 to reverse stack Photohistory. Executes method historyButtonM().

    • Constructor Details

      • Controller

        public Controller()

    • Method Details

      • setImage

        public void setImage() throws IOException
        setImage() generates Photo Objects from the JSON Result that is returned from the API. The Photo generated is added to the photos ArrayList. The PhotoIDs are then paired with the index of the photo object in photos arraylist. JavaFX ListView @fx:id photoList then displays the photoIDs as a list. An HTTP Connection is established to the generated URL. The URL generated contains the date specified from dateInput. String Buffer holds the generated URL. Scanner is used to read JSON data from API URL. String JSON then converts JSON data into a usable string. String is then parsed and builds photo objects. The information is then sorted into instance variables of the specific photo objects. If the user wants to view a new date, the data is then cleared. In the event a new list is generated, new IDs are assigned to new photos from the new specified date.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • imageSelect

        public void imageSelect() throws IOException
        imageSelect() sets JavaFX imageView @fx:id imageV to the selected image. Selected image ID is pulled from list generated by method setImage(). imageInfo pulls photo metadata using specified methods from Photo.java Class. In the event mode is -1, the source for the methods changes to the stack.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • downloadImage

        public void downloadImage() throws IOException
        downloadImage() sets a new URL as the URL from the selected image. It then opens the directory selector GUI. The selected directory (folder) is then saved as a file. An input stream is opened and recalls the image from the url specified. The output stream is then opened and the location is then fed in to the designated pathname provided by the directory selector gui. The output stream writer then writes the bytes array directly into the file. Both the input and output streams are then closed.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • copyText

        public void copyText() throws InterruptedException
        copyText() pulls the String from JavaFX TextField @fx:id imgSrcText and puts that string into the clipboard.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • historyButtonM

        public void historyButtonM() throws IOException
        historyButtonM() is a method that gets called if the hyperlink is clicked. It changes JavaFX ListView @fx:id photoList to the stack. Allowing the user to switch between photos and their previously viewed photos.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getHistory

        public void getHistory() throws IOException
        getHistory() Records the PhotoIds into a stack of previously selected images.
        Throws:
        IOException
